alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 10 at 10:02PM MDT until May 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS EASTWARD DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, RIO GRANDE AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEYS, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .A Pacific cold front crossing the region tonight will bring strong west to northwest winds and very low humidity to the area again on Thursday. The greatest confidence for widespread critical fire weather conditions will be from the Sandia and Manzano Mountains eastward. Moisture levels will increase with relatively lighter winds by Thursday night and Friday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest winds at 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph on Thursday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent each afternoon, except up to 20 percent near the Colorado border on Thursday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
